name: CPOM retention
functionStatement: Organic matter is captured and broken down, fueling food webs, balancing production/ respiration, moderating pH/ redox, and supplying nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Leaf litter/coarse organic matter are visibly retained, supporting detrital processes per local references.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count leaf packs and small debris dams, or infer retention from wood presence and low-velocity habitat during a field visit.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Bed largely bare with thin organic film or black, anoxic conditions
Criteria: No effective retention or severe overload causing anoxia

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Only scattered leaves on bars or in eddies. Bed often scoured clean
Criteria: Sparse organic matter and limited retention

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Leaf packs present but many flush out after moderate storms
Criteria: Some retention with partial flushing

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Stable leaf packs lodged behind wood and in low-velocity pockets along most of the reach
Criteria: Abundant CPOM retention and multiple debris accumulations typical for forested systems

references: planform complexity from imagery as supporting context.
